Clayton Kinder

Web Developer

Hey there! My name is Clayton Kinder. I am a web developer currently residing in Charleston, South Carolina and am currently employed by PlayPosit. As a developer, it is my duty to create clean, clear, and creative websites that both astound and inform. I use state-of-the-art web technologies to achieve this standard. When I'm not battling the web development demons, I enjoy video games, playing guitar, and swimming.

WORK

PlayPosit Profile

(11/17 - 12/17)

I was contracted by PlayPosit to develop a profile settings page. I handled frontend and backend development, utilizing Vue.js, NodeJS, Express.js, MySQL, and a hint of PHP. The final product is a powerhouse of a webpage that oozes modern material design.

Express.js
MySQL
Node.js
PHP
Vue.js

Beacon

(9/17 - 11/17)

My largest project yet, I built Beacon as a web application designed around connecting people with those around them. I used many technologies that were unfamiliar to me at the time but proved to be a great boon in development. I built out both the frontend and backend of this website, choosing to create a separate API to handle all server needs.

Express.js
MongoDB
Node.js
Stylus
Quasar
Vue.js

The Village at Coosaw

(8/17 - 9/17)

A Wordpress site that I built for a nearby shopping center. I handled all aspects of development and provided a website that completely met the needs of the client while remaining simple enough for anyone to update in the Wordpress backend.

PHP
Wordpress

Good Done Great

(5/16 - 7/17)

During my time at Good Done Great, I was tasked with completely redeveloping the pre-login portion of our web application. It was absolutely paramount to keep the design clean while still making sure that our mission was clearly communicated to all users and I am very proud of the result. Looking past the pre-login section, I also helped develop a social media feed and a multitude of pages, forms, modals, and charts.

AngularJS
SASS

Design Lab

(3/16)

A website that I built from a Photoshop mockup. Utilizes clean design for an optimal viewing experience.

SASS

Elefgee

(8/15)

Elefgee is a web application designed by a colleague and I that serves as a way for gamers to find people to play games with. This project was my first venture into NodeJS and was a great exercise in back-end development, APIs, and managing user accounts and data. Although the site is no longer live, this marked my first full-stack application.

AngularJS
Express.js
jQuery
MongoDB
NodeJS
SASS

Kraftee

(7/15)

Kraftee was my first project that used AngularJS. The idea was to expand my knowledge of MVC systems by creating a fake digital storefront using the Etsy API.

AngularJS
jQuery
SASS

Briefcases & Bureaucrats

(6/15)

Through the power of JavaScript and jQuery, I have created what I believe to be the world's first business-themed fighting game. This was created as an exercise in constructors, arrays, and functions. Watch out for Franklin from management!

jQuery
SASS

Peralta

(5/15)

For one of my first projects, I recreated the Peralta website. In order to do this, I made use of all the wonderful abilities that SASS adds to vanilla CSS. This project taught me positioning, styling, and proper HTML layouts.

SASS
